alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 10:02AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Oklahoma, including the following county, Garfield. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1002 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.3 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.7 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Enid, Waukomis, Vance Air Force Base and North Enid. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
